mature.translation[0].definitions[0].def: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave
mature.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Laura is very mature for her age.
We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
mature.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Mature apple trees are typically 20 feet tall.
The new leader wants his country to be seen as a mature democracy.
The human brain isn’t fully mature until about age 25.
Most girls are sexually mature by about 14 years of age.
mature.translation[0].definitions[2].def: mature cheese, wine etc has a good strong taste which has developed during a long period of time
mature.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a polite or humorous way of describing someone who is no longer young
mature.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: a respectable gentleman of mature years
mature.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a mature piece of work by a writer or an artist is done late in their life and shows a high level of understanding or skill
mature.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: His mature work reveals a deep sense of enjoyment of nature.
mature.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a mature bond or policy is ready to be paid
mature.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to become fully grown or developed
mature.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: As the fish matures, its colours and patternings change.
She has matured into a fine writer.
mature.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to become sensible and start to behave sensibly and reasonably, like an adult
mature.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He has matured a lot since he left home.
He wants to prove just how much he has matured both as a player and as a man.
mature.translation[1].definitions[2].def: if a financial arrangement such as a bond or an insurance policy matures, it becomes ready to be paid
mature.translation[1].definitions[3].def: if cheese, wine etc matures, or if it is matured, it develops a good strong taste over a period of time
mature.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: Few beers brewed in Britain are matured in the bottle.
The olives are pulped, then left to mature.
mature.translation[2].definitions[0].def: if a financial arrangement such as a bond or an INSURANCE POLICY matures, it becomes ready to be paid
mature.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The debentures will mature in five years’ time.
mature.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The country’s economy has matured and become more open to competition.
mature.translation[2].definitions[2].def: if an industry or market matures, it stops growing as fast as before, and the number of competitors decreases
mature.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: When the market begins to mature, it is increasingly difficult for new entrants to gain a significant position.
mature.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a mature industry or market is one where growth is relatively low and there are fewer competitors than before
mature.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Many emerging markets have outpaced  (=developed more quickly than) more mature markets such as the U.S. and Japan.
